entry.title: test 4
entry.content:
function loadScript(url, callback, crossorigin = true) {  const script = document.createElement('script')  script.src = url  script.type = 'text/javascript'  script.async = true  if (crossorigin) script.crossOrigin = 'anonymous'  if (callback) script.onload = callback  document.head.appendChild(script)}function loadStyle(url, crossorigin = true) {  const link = document.createElement('link')  link.href = url  link.rel = 'stylesheet'  if (crossorigin) link.crossOrigin = 'anonymous'  document.head.appendChild(link)}
code, kbd, pre {  font-family: Consolas, Monaco, SFMono-Regular, 'Andale Mono', 'Liberation Mono', 'Ubuntu Mono', Menlo, monospace;  font-size: .9em}code {  color: var(--code);  background-color: var(--alt);  margin: auto .2em;  padding: .2em .3em .1em;  overflow-wrap: break-word;  border-radius: .25em;  vertical-align: .1em}

Consolas,Monaco,SFMono-Regular,'Andale M ono','Liberation Mono','Ubuntu Mono',Menlo,monospace; 123214312421515

Downdown Windows Typora, MarkdownPad, MarkPad OSX Mou, Ulysses, iA Writer, Typed, MacDown, Typora GNU Emacs, Vim, Sublime Tex, Atom

Markdown .md .markdown

1. Markdown

1.1

emphasize emphasize

emphasize strong

1.2 Email

    • Item 2b

3. Bird1. McHale8. Parish

HTML Markdown

1. Markdown start 

1986. What a great season.

--

1986\. What a great season.

1.6 

> Email-style angle brackets.  > are used for blockquotes.  > > And, they can be nested.  > #### Headers in blockquotes. >   > * You can quote a list.  > * Etc.

Email-style angle brackets
are used for blockquotes.

And, they can be nested.

Headers in blockquotes

  • You can quote a list.
  • Etc.

1.7

<code><code>

4 1

#!/usr/bin/perluse strict;use warnings;# first, create your messageuse Email::MIME;my $message = Email::MIME->create(  header_str => [    From    => 'you@example.com',    To      => 'friend@example.com',    Subject => 'Happy birthday!',  ],  attributes => {    encoding => 'quoted-printable',    charset  => 'ISO-8859-1',  },  body_str => "Happy birthday to you!\n",);# send the messageuse Email::Sender::Simple qw(sendmail);sendmail($message);

GitHub linguist

- [x] @mentions, #refs, [links](), **formatting**, and <del>tags</del> supported- [x] list syntax required (any unordered or ordered list supported)- [x] this is a complete item- [ ] this is an incomplete item

entry.title: FAQ
entry.content:
How do I put text instead of an image as my sites logo?

If you consider using a piece of text instead of an image as the logo of your site, you can do something like this:

_config.yml
logo:    text: My Beautiful Site

How do I change the sites language?

Edit your blogs _config.yml(not your themes), change the following field:

- language: en+ language: zh-CN

You can find available translations under icarus/languages folder.

How to add an excerpt for a post? How to display the Read more button?

Add <!-- more --> tag in your post. Post content before this tag will be marked as an excerpt and content after this tag will not show on the index page.

Why arent my changes deployed to the Github Pages?

Please run these commands before hexo deploy:

$ hexo clean$ rm -r .deploy_git

How to add meta tags for a specified post/page?

You can add meta tags for each post/page through front-matter:

title: test postdate: 2015-01-26 21:55:37tags:comments: false+ meta:+ - name="robots";content="noindex, follow"+ - name="another-meta";value="hello world";enabled=false

Does this theme support RTL(Right-to-Left) language?

Partially yes. Please refer to Issues#234

Christopher Czermak

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

Create a new post

$ hexo new "My New Post"

More info: Writing

Run server

$ hexo server

More info: Server

Generate static files

$ hexo generate

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

$ hexo deploy

More info: Deployment
